customer_name: Pecks Farm Market II East LLC
site_name: Pecks Farm Market II East LLC

citations.narrative:
The grain storage for deer has broken bags and spilled feed around it from what the representative said is a squirrel that
has been getting into the bags. Wild animals getting into feed can contaminate it and cause animals to get sick. Ensure to
store feed in a manner the protects it against deterioration, molding, or contamination by vermin.
***Correct by July 15, 2024.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility provides areas for species typical behavior and social behaviors for their birds, however a written plan for
environment enhancement that is approved by the attending veterinarian (AV) was not available for inspection. Following
a written plan that is approved by the AV helps ensure that each species of birds is being provided with adequate
environmental enhancement. Ensure that a plan is developed and approved by the AV and is available for future
inspections.
***Correct by August 16, 2024.

A group of peafowl and guinea fowl have access to a pool of water that ducks swim in and is refreshed by continuous
artesian flow, however the water is on the ground and so is not potable water. Having drinking water access limited to
ground/pool water access rather than potable water could cause health problems in birds. Potable water must be provided
in sufficient quantity to every bird housed at the facility, unless restricted by the attending veterinarian. Ensure each bird
has access to potable drinking water.
***Correct by July 4, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.125(c) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The grain storage for deer has broken bags and spilled feed around it from what the representative said is a squirrel that 
has been getting into the bags. Wild animals getting into feed can contaminate it and cause animals to get sick. Ensure to 
store feed in a manner the protects it against deterioration, molding, or contamination by vermin.  
***Correct by July 15, 2024. 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The facility provides areas for species typical behavior and social behaviors for their birds, however a written plan for 
environment enhancement that is approved by the attending veterinarian (AV) was not available for inspection. Following 
a written plan that is approved by the AV helps ensure that each species of birds is being provided with adequate 
environmental enhancement. Ensure that a plan is developed and approved by the AV and is available for future 
inspections.  
***Correct by August 16, 2024. 
3.156 
   
Watering 
A group of peafowl and guinea fowl have access to a pool of water that ducks swim in and is refreshed by continuous 
artesian flow, however the water is on the ground and so is not potable water. Having drinking water access limited to 
ground/pool water access rather than potable water could cause health problems in birds. Potable water must be provided 
in sufficient quantity to every bird housed at the facility, unless restricted by the attending veterinarian. Ensure each bird 
has access to potable drinking water.  
***Correct by July 4, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
